camel.source.path.user.name: camel.source.path.user
camel.source.path.user.description: The user name to send a direct message. This will be ignored for consumer.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWh.name: camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWh.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

camel.source.endpoint.type.name: camel.source.endpoint.type
camel.source.endpoint.type.description: Endpoint type to use. One of: [polling] [direct]

camel.source.endpoint.distanceMetric.name: camel.source.endpoint.distanceMetric
camel.source.endpoint.distanceMetric.description: Used by the geography search, to search by radius using the configured metrics. The unit can either be mi for miles, or km for kilometers. You need to configure all the following options: longitude, latitude, radius, and distanceMetric. One of: [km] [mi]

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.extendedMode.name: camel.source.endpoint.extendedMode
camel.source.endpoint.extendedMode.description: Used for enabling full text from twitter (eg receive tweets that contains more than 140 characters).

camel.source.endpoint.latitude.name: camel.source.endpoint.latitude
camel.source.endpoint.latitude.description: Used by the geography search to search by latitude. You need to configure all the following options: longitude, latitude, radius, and distanceMetric.

camel.source.endpoint.locations.name: camel.source.endpoint.locations
camel.source.endpoint.locations.description: Bounding boxes, created by pairs of lat/lons. Can be used for filter. A pair is defined as lat,lon. And multiple paris can be separated by semi colon.

camel.source.endpoint.longitude.name: camel.source.endpoint.longitude
camel.source.endpoint.longitude.description: Used by the geography search to search by longitude. You need to configure all the following options: longitude, latitude, radius, and distanceMetric.

camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy.name: camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy
camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

camel.source.endpoint.radius.name: camel.source.endpoint.radius
camel.source.endpoint.radius.description: Used by the geography search to search by radius. You need to configure all the following options: longitude, latitude, radius, and distanceMetric.

camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.name: camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.source.endpoint.count.name: camel.source.endpoint.count
camel.source.endpoint.count.description: Limiting number of results per page.

camel.source.endpoint.filterOld.name: camel.source.endpoint.filterOld
camel.source.endpoint.filterOld.description: Filter out old tweets, that has previously been polled. This state is stored in memory only, and based on last tweet id.

camel.source.endpoint.lang.name: camel.source.endpoint.lang
camel.source.endpoint.lang.description: The lang string ISO_639-1 which will be used for searching

camel.source.endpoint.numberOfPages.name: camel.source.endpoint.numberOfPages
camel.source.endpoint.numberOfPages.description: The number of pages result which you want camel-twitter to consume.

camel.source.endpoint.sinceId.name: camel.source.endpoint.sinceId
camel.source.endpoint.sinceId.description: The last tweet id which will be used for pulling the tweets. It is useful when the camel route is restarted after a long running.

camel.source.endpoint.userIds.name: camel.source.endpoint.userIds
camel.source.endpoint.userIds.description: To filter by user ids for filter. Multiple values can be separated by comma.

camel.source.endpoint.httpProxyHost.name: camel.source.endpoint.httpProxyHost
camel.source.endpoint.httpProxyHost.description: The http proxy host which can be used for the camel-twitter. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

camel.source.endpoint.httpProxyPassword.name: camel.source.endpoint.httpProxyPassword
camel.source.endpoint.httpProxyPassword.description: The http proxy password which can be used for the camel-twitter. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

camel.source.endpoint.httpProxyPort.name: camel.source.endpoint.httpProxyPort
camel.source.endpoint.httpProxyPort.description: The http proxy port which can be used for the camel-twitter. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

camel.source.endpoint.httpProxyUser.name: camel.source.endpoint.httpProxyUser
camel.source.endpoint.httpProxyUser.description: The http proxy user which can be used for the camel-twitter. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThresh.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThreshold
camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThresh.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThresho.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThreshold
camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThresho.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier
camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

camel.source.endpoint.greedy.name: camel.source.endpoint.greedy
camel.source.endpoint.greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay
camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.name: camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount
camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.

camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel.name: camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel
camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that. One of: [TRACE] [DEBUG] [INFO] [WARN] [ERROR] [OFF]

camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorS.name: camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorService
camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorS.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

camel.source.endpoint.scheduler.name: camel.source.endpoint.scheduler
camel.source.endpoint.scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler

camel.source.endpoint.schedulerPropertie.name: camel.source.endpoint.schedulerProperties
camel.source.endpoint.schedulerPropertie.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.

camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler.name: camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler
camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit.name: camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit
camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options. One of: [NANOSECONDS] [MICROSECONDS] [MILLISECONDS] [SECONDS] [MINUTES] [HOURS] [DAYS]

camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay
camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

camel.source.endpoint.accessToken.name: camel.source.endpoint.accessToken
camel.source.endpoint.accessToken.description: The access token. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

camel.source.endpoint.accessTokenSecret.name: camel.source.endpoint.accessTokenSecret
camel.source.endpoint.accessTokenSecret.description: The access secret. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

camel.source.endpoint.consumerKey.name: camel.source.endpoint.consumerKey
camel.source.endpoint.consumerKey.description: The consumer key. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

camel.source.endpoint.consumerSecret.name: camel.source.endpoint.consumerSecret
camel.source.endpoint.consumerSecret.description: The consumer secret. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

camel.source.endpoint.sortById.name: camel.source.endpoint.sortById
camel.source.endpoint.sortById.description: Sorts by id, so the oldest are first, and newest last.

camel.component.twitter-directmessage.br.name: camel.component.twitter-directmessage.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.twitter-directmessage.br.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.twitter-directmessage.ba.name: camel.component.twitter-directmessage.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.twitter-directmessage.ba.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.component.twitter-directmessage.ht.name: camel.component.twitter-directmessage.httpProxyHost
camel.component.twitter-directmessage.ht.description: The http proxy host which can be used for the camel-twitter.

camel.component.twitter-directmessage.ht.name: camel.component.twitter-directmessage.httpProxyPassword
camel.component.twitter-directmessage.ht.description: The http proxy password which can be used for the camel-twitter.

camel.component.twitter-directmessage.ht.name: camel.component.twitter-directmessage.httpProxyPort
camel.component.twitter-directmessage.ht.description: The http proxy port which can be used for the camel-twitter.

camel.component.twitter-directmessage.ht.name: camel.component.twitter-directmessage.httpProxyUser
camel.component.twitter-directmessage.ht.description: The http proxy user which can be used for the camel-twitter.
